page.title: 01General Review of the Block
page.content: The area is situated on the southern border of Derbyshire. In contrast to the coal & clay workings which traditionally provided employment to the north east around the town of Swadlincote, it is a rural landscape. The rich loam soil is well suited to the growing of cereal crops and roots. There is also much permanent pasture for beef and dairy cattle. The village of Lullington in the south-west corner of the block provides the main focus of settlement. Smaller concentrations of population are found in Liverpool and Clifton Row. There are also several isolated farmhouses and farm workers cottages. The farming influence is very strong within the community. Most of the inhabitants have some association with agriculture and as a result the area retains a rustic character.
